executiveSummaryContent.businessImpactPoint1: Improved user experience for 15% of the population with disabilities
executiveSummaryContent.businessImpactPoint2: Enhanced SEO performance through better semantic markup
executiveSummaryContent.businessImpactPoint3: Reduced legal compliance risk and ADA lawsuit exposure
executiveSummaryContent.summaryHigh: This website demonstrates strong accessibility practices with a score of {{score}}/100. While there are {{violations}} areas for improvement, the site shows good commitment to inclusive design. Focus on addressing the {{critical}} critical issues to achieve excellent accessibility standards.
executiveSummaryContent.summaryMedium: This website shows moderate accessibility implementation with a score of {{score}}/100. There are {{violations}} violations that need attention, including {{critical}} critical issues that should be prioritized. Systematic improvements will significantly enhance user experience for people with disabilities.
executiveSummaryContent.summaryLow: This website requires significant accessibility improvements with a score of {{score}}/100. The {{violations}} violations identified, including {{critical}} critical issues, present barriers for users with disabilities. Immediate action is recommended to ensure legal compliance and inclusive user experience.

interpretations.excellentDescription: Your website demonstrates exceptional accessibility standards and serves as a model for inclusive design.
interpretations.goodDescription: Your website meets most accessibility standards with room for optimization to achieve excellence.
interpretations.moderateDescription: Your website has accessibility foundations but requires attention to critical issues for full compliance.
interpretations.poorDescription: Your website has significant accessibility barriers that prevent users with disabilities from accessing content.

violations.noCriticalIssuesTitle: ðŸŽ‰ Excellent! No Critical Issues Found
violations.noCriticalIssuesDescription: Your website meets the highest accessibility standards for critical and serious violations.
violations.noDetailedViolations: âœ“ No accessibility violations detected in detailed analysis!

quickFixes.colorContrast: Increase text color contrast to meet 4.5:1 ratio for normal text, 3:1 for large text
quickFixes.imageAlt: Add descriptive alt attributes to images:
quickFixes.label: Associate labels with form inputs: <label for="email">Email</label><input id="email">
quickFixes.headingOrder: Use headings in logical order: h1 > h2 > h3, don't skip levels
quickFixes.linkName: Provide descriptive link text or aria-label for meaningful context
quickFixes.buttonName: Add text content or aria-label to buttons for screen readers
quickFixes.focusOrder: Ensure interactive elements have proper focus indicators and logical tab order
quickFixes.keyboard: Make all interactive elements accessible via keyboard navigation
quickFixes.ariaAllowed: Use only valid ARIA attributes according to element roles
quickFixes.ariaRequired: Add required ARIA attributes for proper accessibility semantics
quickFixes.default: Review WCAG guidelines for specific implementation details

colorContrast.aaDescription: Minimum contrast: 4.5:1 normal text, 3:1 large text
colorContrast.aaaDescription: Enhanced contrast: 7:1 normal text, 4.5:1 large text
colorContrast.contrastTooLow: Text contrast ratio is below accessibility standards
colorContrast.noViolationsDescription: All text elements meet WCAG contrast requirements for accessibility.
colorContrast.mainIssue: Text contrast is below accessibility standards
colorContrast.howToFix: Increase contrast between text and background colors to meet WCAG AA requirements (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text).
colorContrast.toolRecommendation: ðŸ’¡ Use browser developer tools or contrast checkers like WebAIM Contrast Checker to test colors.
colorContrast.nextStepsDetails: Use your browser's developer tools to inspect elements and adjust CSS color values. Test all changes with a contrast checker before publishing.

imageAlt.title: Adding Alt Text to Images
imageAlt.explanation: Provide descriptive alternative text for screen readers

formLabeling.title: Proper Form Labeling
formLabeling.explanation: Associate labels with form controls for accessibility

keyboardNav.title: Keyboard Navigation Support
keyboardNav.explanation: Use semantic HTML elements for proper keyboard support

colorContrast.title: Color Contrast Improvement
colorContrast.explanation: Ensure sufficient contrast for text readability

bestPractices.screenReaders: Test with actual screen readers (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver)
bestPractices.keyboardTesting: Implement keyboard navigation testing in your workflow
bestPractices.automatedTesting: Use automated testing tools as part of CI/CD pipeline
bestPractices.userTesting: Involve users with disabilities in testing when possible
bestPractices.training: Train development team on accessibility principles

methodology.title: Testing Methodology & Tools
methodology.description: Our comprehensive accessibility analysis employs industry-leading tools and methodologies:

tools.axeCore: â€¢ Axe-core v4.7+ - Deque Systems' accessibility testing engine
tools.wcagValidation: â€¢ WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance validation
tools.browserTesting: â€¢ Automated browser testing with Puppeteer
tools.heuristicEvaluation: â€¢ Custom heuristic evaluation for usability
tools.colorContrast: â€¢ Color contrast analysis and measurement

perceivable.title: Perceivable
perceivable.description: Information and UI components must be presentable to users in ways they can perceive

guidelines.textAlternatives: Text alternatives for images and non-text content
guidelines.adaptable: Content can be presented without losing meaning
guidelines.distinguishable: Sufficient color contrast between text and background

operable.title: Operable
operable.description: User interface components and navigation must be operable

guidelines.timing: Users have enough time to read content
guidelines.seizures: Content does not cause seizures or physical reactions
guidelines.navigable: Users can navigate and find content

understandable.title: Understandable
understandable.description: Information and the operation of user interface must be understandable

guidelines.predictable: Web pages appear and operate predictably
guidelines.inputAssistance: Users are helped to avoid and correct mistakes

robust.title: Robust
robust.description: Content must be robust enough for interpretation by assistive technologies

points.ada: Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) compliance requirements
points.eaa: European Accessibility Act (EAA) for EU businesses
points.wcag: WCAG 2.1 AA as the recognized international standard

ada.description: Applies to businesses open to the public, requiring accessible websites for equal access

section508.description: Federal agencies must ensure electronic information is accessible to people with disabilities

en301549.description: European standard for ICT accessibility requirements in public procurement

aoda.description: Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act - applies to Ontario businesses

professional.webaim: WebAIM (webaim.org) - Comprehensive accessibility training and resources
professional.dequeUniversity: Deque University - Professional accessibility training courses
professional.iaap: IAAP Certification - International Association of Accessibility Professionals
professional.mdn: MDN Accessibility Docs - Mozilla Developer Network accessibility guide

testing.colorContrast: Color Contrast Analyzer - Free desktop application for contrast testing
testing.nvda: NVDA Screen Reader - Free screen reader for Windows testing
testing.voiceOver: VoiceOver - Built-in macOS screen reader for testing
testing.chromeDevTools: Chrome DevTools Accessibility Panel - Built-in browser testing tools
testing.axeDevTools: axe DevTools Browser Extension - Browser-based accessibility testing

contact.title: Questions about this report?
contact.description1: Contact our accessibility experts for implementation support, training, and consulting services.
contact.description2: We provide ongoing support to help your team achieve and maintain accessibility compliance.

altText.definition: Alternative text that describes images for screen readers

aria.definition: Accessible Rich Internet Applications - attributes that enhance HTML semantics

focusManagement.definition: Controlling where keyboard focus moves through interactive elements

screenReader.definition: Assistive technology that reads web content aloud for blind users

semanticHtml.definition: HTML that uses meaningful elements to describe content structure

skipLinks.definition: Hidden links that allow keyboard users to skip to main content

descriptions.criticalAccessibilityIssues: Your website has {{count}} critical accessibility issue that severely impact users with disabilities.
descriptions.criticalAccessibilityIssues_plural: Your website has {{count}} critical accessibility issues that severely impact users with disabilities.
descriptions.imagesMeaninglessAlt: {{count}} image has meaningless alt text like '...', 'image', or filename.
descriptions.imagesMeaninglessAlt_plural: {{count}} images have meaningless alt text like '...', 'image', or filename.
descriptions.imagesMissingAndMeaninglessAlt: {{missing}} images are missing alt text and {{meaningless}} have meaningless alt text ({{total}} total issues).
descriptions.formFieldsMissingLabels: {{count}} form field is missing proper labels.
descriptions.formFieldsMissingLabels_plural: {{count}} form fields are missing proper labels.
descriptions.accessibilityIssuesOverview: Your website has accessibility issues that may impact users with disabilities and legal compliance.
descriptions.contentFormsAccessibility: Some images and form elements may not be accessible to users with assistive technologies.
descriptions.missingH1Heading: Your page is missing an H1 heading.

actions.reviewCriticalViolations: Review and fix all critical violations immediately. See detailed violation list below.
actions.addDescriptiveAltText: Add descriptive alt text to all images that convey information. See specific images in detailed analysis below.
actions.associateLabelsWithFormFields: Associate labels with form fields using <label> elements or aria-label attributes. See detailed form analysis below.
actions.adjustColorContrast: Adjust text and background colors to meet WCAG contrast requirements. See specific elements in detailed analysis below.
actions.getDetailedReport: Get detailed report to see specific issues and step-by-step fixing instructions.
actions.upgradeToDetailedReport: Upgrade to detailed report for specific locations and implementation guidance.
actions.addClearH1Heading: Add a clear H1 heading that describes the main content of the page
actions.addDescriptiveTextToLinks: Add descriptive text to all links or use aria-label for icon links

footer.poweredBy: Powered by SiteCraft - Professional Web Accessibility Analysis
footer.contactUs: Contact our team for implementation support and ongoing accessibility consulting.
